result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gavin Broderick Vance

records.addlTxt:
12:28 PM Defendant Gavin Broderick Vance in court.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Gavin Broderick Vance.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:54 AM Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Gavin Broderick Vance.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Clerk emailed signed signature bond to court info at GCSD

Violation: Poss THC, 4 cts Misd Bail Jumping
Issuing Agency: Monroe PD
May not possess or consume any intoxicants. 
May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant. 
May not enter establishments (to include bars, taverns, or other premises) whose primary purpose is the sale of intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold.

9:31 AM Defendant Gavin Broderick Vance in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Gavin Broderick Vance.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing waiver form filed with The Court. The defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing. The Court accepts the waiver. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Defense has received copy of the information. Not Guilty pleas entered on all counts. Parties request bond to be amended. The Court orders clerk to amend bond to $1000 signature bond, same monetary conditions. Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
